text:
The beauty and the curse of twitter is that one often will directly engage with the people  who created a thing.

And so while normally one might feel like one is casually griping about X into the void, Actually it reaches the creators of X. and it doesn’t come across well.

elements.text:
The beauty and the curse of twitter is that one often will directly engage with the people  who created a thing.

And so while normally one might feel like one is casually griping about X into the void, Actually it reaches the creators of X. and it doesn’t come across well.

text:
<https://twitter.com/johnmyleswhite/status/1360377799412957188>
<https://www.linkedin.com/posts/casey-kneale-74b02b158_caseyknealepickingalanguage2020-activity-6766153357439643648-JB8F>

I self-censor very heavily on twitter.
Erring in the side of not saying a thing, or peacemaking.
And only posting purely technical content of my own.

elements.text:
I self-censor very heavily on twitter.
Erring in the side of not saying a thing, or peacemaking.

text: I definitely didn't mean offense in either of the cases... But both times there are people stretching statements to their extremes

elements.text: I definitely didn't mean offense in either of the cases... But both times there are people stretching statements to their extremes

text: Grammarly didn't tell me I was being a jerk, my filter is a bit poor, but I'm on some new med's and that should help lol. I'm trying, but I think you're right Lyndon, just say less and filter critical comments more.

elements.text: Grammarly didn't tell me I was being a jerk, my filter is a bit poor, but I'm on some new med's and that should help lol. I'm trying, but I think you're right Lyndon, just say less and filter critical comments more.

text: not everyone can handle or wants to have unbiased technical discussions where a dope like me is in all likelihood WRONG. I engage in discussions like that to have people educate me, and test my assumptions. I think a lot of people aren't built that way, or my tone is bad.

elements.text: not everyone can handle or wants to have unbiased technical discussions where a dope like me is in all likelihood WRONG. I engage in discussions like that to have people educate me, and test my assumptions. I think a lot of people aren't built that way, or my tone is bad.

text: seems like holding edge cases for people to get a little conspiratorial in mind is important too. I just don't want to make the things I like look bad. I don't care about making myself look bad if its in good fun (VIMKiller).
